summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganThe BareMinerals ultra-silky, talc-free, GEN NUDE Powder Blush builds and blends seamlessly, gives skin a diffused, soft-focus finish - and wears all day.
details: DetailsBenefitsDelivers a healthy wash of color with no harsh edgesSmooths the look of pores and imperfectionsProvides all-day wearDiffuses light for a soft-focus effectProvides buildable, sheer to medium color and a natural soft-matte finishApplies seamlessly with a silky, creamy feelFeaturesAvailable in a range of flattering shades designed for all skin tonesLight-reflecting mineral pearls create a brightened, blurred effectDermatologist-testedHypoallergenicTalc-free + formulated without parabens, formaldehyde, gluten, synthetic fragrance, PEGs and moreKey IngredientsBlurring Mineral Complex: Spherical mineral-based pearls that diffuse light, creating a soft focus blurred effectMineral Pigments: Provide natural, healthy-looking colorItem 2632824How To UseApply GEN NUDE Powder Blush to the apples of your cheeks, blending along your cheekbones. For a soft, diffused look, use an angled brush like the Blooming Blush Brush (sold separately). To create added dimension, pair with any bareMinerals bronzer and highlighter for a radiant, glowing complexion.IngredientsSynthetic Fluorphlogopite, Mica, Diisostearyl Malate, Dipentaerythrityl Hexahydroxystearate, Vinyl Dimethicone/Methicone Silsesquioxane Crosspolymer, Lauroyl Lysine, Triethylhexanoin, Sorbitan Sesquiisostearate, Hydrogen Dimethicone, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Dimethicone, Chlorphenesin, Tocopherol, Silica, Isopropyl Titanium Triisostearate. +/- (May Contain/Peut Contenir) Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Red 7 Lake (CI 15850), Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply GEN NUDE Powder Blush to the apples of your cheeks, blending along your cheekbones. For a soft, diffused look, use an angled brush like the Blooming Blush Brush (sold separately). To create added dimension, pair with any bareMinerals bronzer and highlighter for a radiant, glowing complexion.

reviews.headline: My favorite blush
reviews.comments: I've been using this blush for several years. I don't break out from it, it always goes on well, and lasts throughout the day.  Easy to wash off too. I like the ingredients over some more toxic products out there. I like the color: You Had Me at Merlot.  Not too pink.

reviews.headline: Call my Blush powdered blush
reviews.comments: Why can't I ever find this color blush? Why do t you make more if you see it so popular? What is an alternative color?

reviews.headline: Bare Minerals is a great line.
reviews.comments: Everything from Bare Minerals is a superior product. You won't be disappointed. Just remember, a little goes a long way.

reviews.headline: super sensitive skin safe
reviews.comments: the only blush ive been able to use without triggering my perioral dermatitis. beautiful color, and it's very buildable, so it's up to you how soft or bold the color is!

reviews.headline: Good color
reviews.comments: Very nice color. Wears well.

reviews.headline: Too sheer
reviews.comments: I got the Pretty in Pink.  It's super sheer in color and barely shows up on my skin.  Not my favorite.  Would not purchase again.

reviews.headline: I would by this Blush over and over again.. Bare Minerials..
reviews.comments: I am not a fan of makeup and prefer a more natural look... This product is light and sheer and is so perfect for me.  It looks natural like you had a sun kissed day outside in the sunshime.

reviews.headline: Don't you dare sleep on this blush!
reviews.comments: I ordered the mauve and merlot shades in this blush as a light to medium neutral to warm girly.  The merlot shade will give you the most belivable and flattering blush, amd the mauve is a close second.  Pleasr don't sleep on this smooth and long lasting blush that will elevate your makeup game!  I will never repurchase another brand as long as this is available.  10/10 stars!  Im 46 and not a novice in the makeup game.

reviews.headline: I would buy it again.
reviews.comments: Good color easy apply.

reviews.headline: I love this brand
reviews.comments: I love this brand because it's natural and vegan

reviews.headline: Very nice
reviews.comments: I love the color and how easily I can apply it without being too much!

reviews.headline: That Peach Tho
reviews.comments: One of my favorite blushes. The pigment and shade are perfect for my light warm olive complexion. Goes in flawlessly - awesome product.

reviews.headline: Worst blush ever

reviews.headline: On The Mauve:  older vs. new edition
reviews.comments: Gen Nude-On The Mauve color appears to have changed, so be aware if you are shopping based on the store display units.  Two Ulta locations near me had the old version displayed while they are selling the current version (one of the stores had the correct version alongside the old version).  The prior version has more warm/brown in it than the newer one, which is more of a neutral dark pink/soft raspberry.  I have a hard time buying blush because most colors I try either are too warm/orange, are too deep/red, or are too pastel for my light-medium warm olive skin.  On The Mauve works for me as a neutral everyday blush--as long as I apply it with a light touch.  The product texture is just right--soft enough for color pickup on my brush, yet not so soft as to make a mess of the packaging.  Since buying this, I haven't reached for any of my other blushes and will probably pare down to just this and my wintertime favorite (Fenty Raisin Standardz, a dusky blackberry jam, also applied with a light touch).

reviews.headline: I will but this product again
reviews.comments: I really like the Bare minerals cosmetics.  My fault, I chose the wrong color for me.  I will need to purchase a blush that is much lighter.  bare minerals cosmetics are great.  They were recommended to me by my Dermatologist.

reviews.headline: I So Like This Blush
reviews.comments: It's a  soft  color and talc free blush. This is a pretty color which I so enjoy wearing.

reviews.headline: bareMinerals Gen Nude powder blush is a good product
reviews.comments: I like bareMinerals products...the Gen Nude powder blush is excellent. However, I had to return the blush because On The Mauve was not the correct shade for me. The shade I wanted was not available so I bought a product from a different cosmetic line.

reviews.headline: Call my Blush   Great, when it's in stock.
reviews.comments: Love Bare minerals, but I'm not so sure that Ulta is the place to purchase it.  Doesn't seem to be in stock.  How often is it replenished.  Looks like I need to go to the Bare Minerals site to purchase this and the Complexion Rescue in Suede 04.  Losing sales if you don't stock it.

reviews.headline: Very subtle, easy to use
reviews.comments: I bought this blush in Pretty in Pink. It's much more peach or coral than I thought it would be, but it's so subtle, that I don't mind the color.  I like the way it looks and it is easy to use and is not over-pigmented as some blushes are.

reviews.headline: You Had Me at Merlot !
reviews.comments: I love a fresh, wind-blown cheek in the winter time. I was on the fence with the Merlot blush because it appears maroon online, but the color is a more reddish on the skin. You don't need much, as it has super pigment and lasts all day. The first day I wore it, I received a compliment saying how 'fresh' I looked. Win! I imagine this color is great on all skin tones because of the pigment. I also have Pretty in Pink, and that's a great spring/summer color. GEN NUDE blush is possibly is the best out there when it comes to lasting power.

faceoff_positive.comments: I bought two shades in the recent sale - Strike a Rose and But First Coffee. I've looked at these blushes in store previously and almost purchased before but always held off for some reason. Glad I waited and got them on sale! These blushes are semi sheer with a light application, but are buildable to more intense color payoff if desired. Both shades I got are matte, but they don't look flat or dry or dusty on the face, instead they look skin like and healthy. I especially like but first coffee (the rosy brown shade) which probably looks intimidating as a blush for light skin tones. But it's more subtle and blendable on the cheeks than you might think. It's not like a bronzer shade, it's definitely blush but it's really natural rosy brown that is pretty and dimensional on your skin. Strike a rose is more vibrant, and not quite what I think of as a rose shade. It's more terracotta rose than pink rose. It's very pretty though and I think I will get more use from this shade in the summer when I have more of a tan. Overall, these are both great shades and the formula is buildable, blendable, and long lasting. I like this formula for powder blush quite a bit!
faceoff_positive.headline: Strike a Rose and But First Coffee

faceoff_negative.comments: I was really disappointed when Ready Blush was discontinued, but the consultant in the BM store insisted that the Gen Nude Call my Blush would be close in color and wear to the Ready Blush Indecent Proposal I had used previously. No on both counts. Ready blush blended beautifully and lasted all day. Gen Nude (which comes with no applicator) doesn't blend well regardless of what applicator I use, and doesn't last more than 4 hours Color is more bright rather than a subtle mauve.. I tried to stay with it, but really hated the difference. Last week I found an unopened  Ready Blush Indecent Proposal I'd forgotten I had. What an improvement. I won't use this product again. Am actively looking for a new blush from elsewhere to be my choice when the Ready Blush is gone.  I've used Bare Minerals for 12 years. This is the second time in a year that a product I loved was discontinued and the remaining or new options are unsatisfactory. You're losing me Bare Minerals.
faceoff_negative.headline: Doesn't last, poor replacement for Ready Blush
